intro: Trigonosciadium undulatum, commonly known as the wavy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and have a distinctive wavy margin, while its flowers are yellow and borne in clusters. Trigonosciadium undulatum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
